title: New films scrutinize Brazil's World Cup legacy
text:
2 new films scrutinize Brazil's World Cup legacy; both conclude event was harmful for Brazil 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/13/15 2:57 pm   2:58 pm EDT 
RIO DE JANEIRO â€” Two documentary films argue that hosting the 2014 World Cup was detrimental to Brazil. 
"Brazil vs. Brazil" and "The March of the White Elephants" show the dark underbelly of soccer's mega-event. 
Leading up to the tournament, thousands of poor people were removed from their homes and billions were poured into state-of-the-art stadiums, some of which are now being used as parking lots or wedding venues. The films argue that taxpayers were stuck with the bills for stadiums that cost several times their initial estimates. 
The critical documentaries were screened at the Rio Film Festival, which closes Wednesday. The films come as Brazil enters the final stretch before next year's Olympics in Rio de Janeiro and amid an unfurling corruption crisis at World Cup organizer FIFA.
